column5: Since it's the off season and spring is fast approaching coupled with the time of year most are doing research and trying to plan which unit to upgrade too I thought I'd share this thread I've been following with direct comparisons between Lowrance Downscan and Humminbird Down Imaging.  Some great images here of the same structure take from both Lowrance & Humminbird -  http://bbcboards.zeroforum.com/zerothread?...3630&page=1  I myself I"m looking forward to seeing how the downscan and side imaging performs this season out on the big water.  Cheers, G.
Great post thanks for the link I can't wait till april to see what the update brings out on the Lowrance.   Art

Always think, that brand new technology is great. The one thing is the price. So I tend to buy the technology that the new stuff replaced. I just payed 1400 less on 2 year old technology. I don't get the bragging rights that go along with new. But, At this day an age some newer technology is not better the the old.
Gavin I just updated my humminbird today with the down scan its pretty sweet looking
Which did you buy and where? Good price?  edit: OOPS!
Roy Radio world had the 997 for sale for 1395...an incridible deal considering most pro staff were at 1600 or something last year...

Hey Ma looks like I need more $ this year, we gotta sell one of the kids!!!  Thanks guys, I've narrowed my search down to the Humminbird 997 (and I'm a long time loya lowrance guy - never owned anything but) and just waiting for the spring fishing show
I'm getting real close to pulling the pin on the HDS 7 with structure scan.  any other opinions or experiences out there?
love my 997  cant wait to use the down imaging this year!

i have the hds-8 on the ranger as the main graph and a hummingbird colour unit on the trolling motor while i like both units the hds is the best sonar i have ever seen for target detail can't wait to pick up the structure scan for it
